name: Ehrenpreis conjecture
summary: The Ehrenpreis conjecture, proven by Jeremy Kahn and Vladimir Markovic, states that any two closed Riemann surfaces of genus at least 2 have finite-degree covers that are geometrically close, meaning there exists a diffeomorphism between them with small distortion. This was a long-standing problem in mathematics that establishes a strong connection between any two such surfaces by showing their finite covers can be made arbitrarily close in their geometric properties.
head: \(S\) and \(T\) are any two closed Riemann surfaces of genus at least 2
tail: for any \(K>1\), one can find finite-degree covers \(S^{\prime }\) and \(T^{\prime }\) of \(S\) and \(T\) respectively, such that there exists a \(K\)-quasiconformal map between \(S^{\prime }\) and \(T^{\prime }\).Â
